text:
Attempted to start tomcat by executing startup.sh script under 
CATILINA_HOME\bin. I received the following messages

"rsx not found, DPMI not supported by emx"

browsing did not find http://localhost:8080/
creator: dewayne.c.dantzler@boeing.com

text:
I have never seen that report on tomcat-user or bugzilla.
Check that JAVA_HOME points to the JDK home directory, and that you're not using
a "normal" version of the JDK (I recommend you try with Sun JDK 1.4.1). Also try
with the default Tomcat installation (you might want to try the Windows
installer version also). Reopen the bug if you still have the problem, and can
give steps to reproduce the problem (and please give details about your
configuration).
creator: remm@apache.org

text:
Ok, I would expect it to work for you, but I was more concerned about why the 
script would report the error message. If I knew what would cause that, then I 
could possible determine what is wrong with my setup. 

What is rsx, DPMI, and emx? Are these Windows 2002 applications? 
Also, where can I get a "Default" tomcat installation? Or a Windows installer 
version? What do you mean by more "details" about my configuration? Are you 
talking about the PC, the version of JDK or tomcat? Specifics would be very 
helpful. I admit to being a novice and not an expert, so any details would be 
greatly appreciated. 

Thanks
creator: dewayne.c.dantzler@boeing.com
remm@apache.org
text:
Default install = get the zip, extract it somewhere, don't change anything, and
try to run Tomcat.
If you're on Windows, don't try to run the .sh script (even if you're on
Cygwin). It is for Unix.
I think I mentioned the JDK you should use (IMO).

If you need help, use the tomcat-user mailing list rather than Bugzilla.
Bugzilla is for reporting confirmed *Tomcat* bugs (or at least, when you are
really convinced there's a flaw in Tomcat).
